title: The Value Investor's Edge Live #30: Insights From 6-Bagger Danaos Corp. (DAC)
description:
Evangelos Chatzis, CFO of Danaos Corp. (DAC), a major containership lessor, joined J Mintzmyer's Value Investor's Edge Liveon Nov. 12, 2020, to discuss the containership markets and forward free cash flow potential.
Danaos was a top pick at the time at Value Investor's Edge and traded at a more than 50% discount to net asset value even as underlying market conditions were surging. We had allocated shares to this position at $5.05 in early-September, making DAC a potential 6-bagger as of the 2nd week of January (6x in 4 months). Admittedly DAC outperformed even our wildest expectations and our current 'fair value estimate' is $25/sh. 
Show Notes


(<1:30) Intro/Disclosures 


(1:30) What are the primary drivers of the containership market strength? 


(6:00) Any more opportunities to acquire ships in this market? 


(8:15) Discussion on current adjusted NAV. 


(9:50) Locking in lower cost interest rates? Target liquidity levels? 


(14:00) Potential for more private share repurchases? 


(15:30) Excess free cash for distribution or investments? Dividend plans? 


(22:30) Upcoming plans for the Gemini Joint Venture? 


(23:30) How far ahead can vessels be fixed? For what duration? 


(27:00) Impact of rechartering levels on future free cash flow?
